The local priestesses apparently knew of the art of brewing, as they taught Magister Garuhod some of his recipes.

card.name: Arakron’s mirror images
card.text: Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Arakron’s mirror images.

card.name: Millhouse Manastorm

card.name: Shandris Feathermoon
card.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Moonglade
card.text: Moonglade is a haven for druids, and home of the Cenarion Circle. Here, tauren and night elves coexist peacefully, united by their reverence for the spirit of nature.

card.name: Felwood
card.text: Among its murk-ridden marshes stand settlements built by the orcs, humans, and goblins, as well as the ancient troll temple of Atal’Hakkar. The Swamp of Sorrows

card.name: Swamp of Sorrows
card.text: Among its murk-ridden marshes stand settlements built by the orcs, humans, and goblins, as well as the ancient troll temple of Atal’Hakkar. The Swamp of Sorrows

card.name: Arathi Highlands
card.text: The Arathi Highlands are a region in southeastern Lordaeron, east of Hillsbrad Foothills and south of the Hinterlands. It is a land rich in history, having once been the home of the first human empire of Arathor.

card.name: Teldrassil
card.text: Teldrassil (meaning “Crown of the Earth” in Darnassia) was a World Tree situated on the eponymous island off Kalimdor’s northwestern coast. Created shortly after the Third War by the night elves, Teldrassil served as their home.

card.name: Feralas
card.text: At some point after the Third War, Cho’gall set up a trap for Garona Halforcen who had been hunting him for some time. Deep within the forests of Feralas, he sent his Twilight’s Hammer cultists away and waited for the half-orc.

card.name: Dun Morogh
card.text: The snowy peaks of Dun Morogh have been the home of the dwarves and gnomes for centuries. The two races have generally lived on friendly terms, trading between their own respective cities, Ironforge and Gnomeregan.

card.name: Alterac Valley
card.text: Long ago, before the First War, the warlock Gul’dan exiled a clan of orcs called the Frostwolf Clan to a hidden valley deep in the heart of the Alterac Mountains for refusing to drink the blood of Mannoroth.

card.name: Stranglethorn Vale
card.text: When the Horde invaded Azeroth most of their forces waged war against the humans of Stormwind. However Kilrogg Deadeye led his Bleeding Hollow clan into Stranglethorn Vale, which reminded the orcs of their ancestral home of Tanaan Jungle.

card.name: Wetlands
card.text: After the Second War the area was reconquered and Doomhammer’s port was rebuilt as an Alliance settlement named Menethil Harbor in honor of the king of Lordaeron, Terenas Menethil II.

card.name: Dalaran
card.text: Dalaran is the capital of the magocratic nation of the same name. The city’s inner fortress has served as the focal point for magi and the study of the arcane throughout human history.

card.name: Duskwood
card.text: Duskwood is a fiefdom of the Kingdom of Stormwind located in the southern-central part of Azeroth, south of Elwynn Forest, east of Westfall, west of Deadwind Pass, and north of Stranglethorn Vale.

card.name: Ashenvale
card.text: Ashenvale is a beautiful forest and ancestral home of the Night Elves that has recently come under attack by the Horde. The capital city of Astranaar is under attack, as well as the forest from the Warsong Lumber Camp.

card.name: Darnassus
card.text: Darnassus was the capital city of the night elves of the Alliance, found in western Teldrassil. The High Priestess, Tyrande Whisperwind, resided in the Temple of the Moon, surrounded by other sisters of Elune and the Archdruid Malfurion Stormrage.

card.name: Stormwind
card.text: During the First War, the Kingdom of Azeroth, including its capital, Stormwind Keep, was utterly destroyed by the Horde and its survivors fled to Lordaeron.

card.name: Archmage Arakron
card.text: [+1]: You gain life equal to the number of creatures you control plus the number of planeswalkers you control. [-2]: Create a 2/2 white Mage soldier creature token named Atiesh, Arakron’s Staff with “Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on Atiesh, Arakron’s Staff.” [0]: If you have at least 15 life more than your starting life total, exile Archmage Arakron and each artifact and creature your opponents control.

card.name: Suramar
card.text: Suramar was the location of the Temple of Elune, the central place of worship for the night elves. The high priestess of Elune lived in the temple.

card.name: Ironforge
card.text: Ironforge is the capital city of the dwarves, a member of the Alliance. It is the ancestral home of the Bronzebeard dwarves.

card.name: Alleria Windrunner
card.text:
Flying When Alleria Windrunner enters the battlefield, you may reveal a card you own named Alleria Windrunner from outside the game and put it into your hand.
“Your heart flew straight as any arrow upon the wind, sister. You were the brightest of our Order. You were the most beloved of our kin.”

You may put a permanent card with mana value 3 or less from among them onto the battlefield with a shield counter on it. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. [-7]: Create five 3/3 white Angel creature tokens with fliying.
